485: Job Title: Research Project Coordinator Reports to: Director of Products and User Experience FLSA: Non-Exempt, Part-time Department: Product Location : Remote Job Summary: The Research Project Coordinator works with on GoodMaps School Research Project with COMS at schools for the blind across the country. The Research Project Coordinator primarily focuses on project communication, data-analysis, note-taking, and report writing. This includes coordinating email and phone communication between research project participants, analyzing research data, and being responsive to changing priorities. The Research Project Coordinator will work closely with our UX Researcher to facilitate research studies and ensure effective communication between research project participants and the Product & UX Team. The position is a maximum of 20 hours per week and remote. Supervisory Responsibilities: None Duties/Responsibilities: Coordinate email and phone communication between research project participants, including busy teachers, school staff, regional administration, and state-level administration. Analyze research data and prepare reports on findings, including deep dives and executive summaries. Take notes during moderated in-depth interviews (IDIs) with research participants. Ensure that all written communications are accessible for screen readers and other assistive technologies used by students who are blind or visually impaired. Be responsive to changing priorities and understand complex problems. Manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively and efficiently. Maintain project schedules and timelines. Provide excellent customer service to project participants. Maintain project documentation and files. Required Skills/Abilities: Possess excellent communication skills, including written, verbal, and interpersonal skills. Demonstrate strong analytical skills with experience in conducting research studies. Ability to analyze data and prepare reports. Exhibit strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively and efficiently. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Possess strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills. Ability to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities. Knowledge of research methodologies, including IDIs and survey research. Excellent attention to detail and accuracy. Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Education and Experience: Possess a Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as psychology, sociology, or marketing research. Have 2-3 years of experience in research coordination, data analysis, and report writing. Experience conducting IDIs and other research studies. Experience with remote research tools, such as Zoom, Teams, and SurveyMonkey, is a plus. Physical Requirements: The remote position requires the candidate to have access to a reliable internet connection and a quiet work environment. Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.
